info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 8:40PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Franklin, Stephens and southwestern Oconee Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 840 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Toccoa, or near Gumlog, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Lavonia, Gumlog, Martin, Avalon, Tugaloo State Park, Boydville, Eastanolee and Oakway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
